intro: Phlomoides vulnerans, commonly known as the bleeding phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. The common name "bleeding phlomoides" refers to the sap that can exude from damaged stems, which may have a reddish or purplish hue.
